specific_request_instructions.text:
In the “Request Description” box, please describe with as much specificity as possible the record(s) you are requesting. Include, as applicable, the following information:
  • Project name
  • Address
  • Borough(s)
  • Block numbers(s)
  • Lot number(s)
  • CP or ULURP number(s)
  • CEQR number(s)
  • Relevant dates
  • Type of record(s)
Please note: Broadly worded requests seeking “any” or “all” records related to a subject matter have the potential to implicate hundreds if not thousands of records, including emails. Requests for emails require an extensive search, and a determination regarding such a broad request typically takes a minimum of sixty (60) business days. If making a request for emails, when possible, the specific sender(s) and recipient(s) should be identified, as well as specific date ranges.

See more information about the Department's FOIL procedures.

specific_request_instructions.text:
Requests for Payroll/Employment records should be directed to:
 Director Payroll & Benefits Division
 90 Church Street, 12th Floor
 New York, NY 10007

Requests for Medical Records should be directed to:
 Medical Division
 1 Lefrak City Plaza, 16th Floor
 59-17 Junction Blvd.
 Corona, NY 11368

Criminal History/Background Checks:
Requests for Criminal History/Background checks, should be directed to the NYS Division of Criminal Justice Services website:
http://www.criminaljustice.ny.gov/ojis/recordreview.htm

You can also submit a request in writing to:
 New York State Division of Criminal Justice Services
 80 S Swan Street
 Albany, NY 12210

Collision Reports:
Requestors seeking Collision Reports taken by the New York City Police Department (NYPD) before September 30, 2016 should access the New York State Department of Motor Vehicles website:
http://dmv.ny.gov/get-accident-report

You can also submit a request in writing to:
 NYSDMV, MV-198 C Processing
 6 Empire State Plaza
 Albany, NY 12228

Requestors seeking Collision Reports taken by the New York City Police Department (NYPD) after September 30, 2016 should access the NYPD's Collision Report website:
https://collisionreport.nypdonline.org/
